author: Erik Wasson, Jarrell Dillard, Ken Tran
description: Conservative hardliners’ resistance to Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending package began to soften late Wednesday as the president and his allies worked to win them over.
title: GOP Resistance Softens as Trump Presses House on Tax Package

author: Saleha Mohsin, Joshua Green, Amara Omeokwe
description: As President Donald Trump and his advisers begin weighing replacements for Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, they’re running into one significant complication: It’s not clear that Powell will leave the US central bank next year.
title: Powell Silence on His Future Complicates Trump Fed Chair Search

author: Yash Roy, Steven T. Dennis
description: Gamblers are raising the alarm about a $1.1 billion tax hike buried in the Senate GOP’s tax bill that would slash their net winnings and potentially charge income tax when they break even or lose money.
title: Gamblers Raise Alarm Over $1.1 Billion Tax Hike in Trump’s Bill

author: Alex Wickham
description: UK Prime Minister Keir Starmer said Rachel Reeves will stay on as Chancellor of the Exchequer, as he sought to draw a line under speculation about her future that sparked a bond selloff.
title: Starmer Says Reeves Will Stay as UK Chancellor Despite Setbacks

author: Jonathan Gilbert
description: Oil exports are ramping up from the Vaca Muerta shale deposit in Patagonia after years of false starts. It’s a boom the libertarian president is counting on.
title: Milei Is Tapping Argentina’s Permian in a Bid to Cement His Reforms

author: Sakura Murakami, Erica Yokoyama
description: Campaigning for Japan’s upper house election starts Thursday with the fate of Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba and his minority government hanging in the balance.
title: Japanese PM Ishiba’s Make-or-Break Election Campaign to Kick Off

author: Paige Smith, Claire Ballentine
description: President Donald Trump’s signature tax legislation is poised to benefit companies offering private student loans, including SoFi Technologies Inc., with the bill limiting how much students and their parents can borrow for college from the government.
title: Trump’s Tax Bill Set to Help SoFi, Other Private Student Lenders

author: Ryan Chua
description: A fresh CIA review agreed with earlier conclusions that Russia interfered in the 2016 election to help President Donald Trump beat Hillary Clinton — while criticizing what it called procedural flaws.
title: Trump’s CIA Backs 2016 Assessment That Putin Wanted Him to Win

author: Courtney McBride, Jamie Tarabay
description: Lawmakers, former diplomats and experts questioned the Trump administration’s decision to halt the supply of some air-defense weapons to Ukraine, saying the move risks prolonging the war with Russia and leaving the country more vulnerable to stepped-up missile and drone barrages.
title: Pentagon Under Scrutiny Over Decision to Halt Weapons to Ukraine

author: Philip Aldrick
description: The UK government’s series of costly policy reversals in recent weeks, combined with slow growth, weak tax receipts and higher spending demands are threatening to leave Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves with a hole to fill in her autumn budget measured in the tens of billions of pounds.
title: How Labour’s Reeves Might Fix UK’s Expanding Budgetary Hole

author: Alex Wickham
description: UK financial markets tumbled on Wednesday after Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves’ tearful appearance in Parliament stoked speculation about her future in Keir Starmer’s government.
title: McFadden, Jones Top UK Bookmakers’ List of Reeves Successors

author: Sommer Saadi, Stephanie Flanders
description: In this episode of Trumponomics, we explore the potential for collateral damage and whether there will be an upside in the longer term for US-born workers.
title: What Will Be the Economic Fallout of Trump’s Immigration Crackdown?

author: Paige Smith
description: Bill Pulte, who leads the Federal Housing Finance Agency, called on Congress to investigate Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell, alleging that his recent testimony to the Senate about the central bank’s planned renovations to its headquarters was “deceptive.”
title: Fed’s Powell Should Be Investigated by Congress, FHFA Head Says

author: Randy Thanthong-Knight
description: Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney is meeting with automotive executives Wednesday to discuss how to help auto plants that have been choked by US tariffs.
title: Carney Meets With Automakers as Canada’s Factories Show Tariff Strain

author: William Horobin
description: France must urgently take steps to rein in public finances or soon be forced into painful austerity, the country’s audit court said, highlighting the difficulties for a minority government already at risk of collapse over fiscal plans.
title: France Urgently Needs to Get a Grip on Finances, Auditor Warns

author: Ellen M Gilmer
description: Homeland Security Secretary Kristi Noem is seeking advice on “how to fire people who don’t like us” as she moves to overhaul a workforce that she complained “hasn’t been required to do much.”
title: Kristi Noem Looks to Fire Homeland Security Workers ‘Who Don’t Like Us’

author: Patrick Gillespie
description: A federal judge granted former Argentine President Cristina Kirchner’s request for Brazil’s leftist leader, Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, to visit her this week in Buenos Aires while she’s under house arrest.
title: Argentine Judge Allows Lula to Visit Kirchner Under House Arrest

author: Andra Timu
description: Romania’s far-right former presidential frontrunner Calin Georgescu, whose shock victory in last year’s first-found ballot triggered a months-long political crisis, was sent to trial by prosecutors.
title: Romanian Pro-Russian Ex-Presidential Frontrunner to Face Trial

author: Ruth Olurounbi
description: Nigeria’s main opposition parties, which have agreed to unite to contest 2027 elections under the banner of the little-known African Democratic Congress, appointed two interim leaders to steer preparations for their campaign.
title: Nigerian Opposition Alliance Names Interim Leaders Ahead of Vote

author: Levin Stamm, Bastian Benrath-Wright, Manuela Tobias
description: The European Free Trade Association of Switzerland, Norway, Liechtenstein and Iceland concluded negotiations on a free-trade agreement with South America’s Mercosur countries in a push for more transatlantic commerce.
title: Swiss-Norway Group and South America’s Mercosur Agree on Free-Trade Deal

author: Hugo Miller
description: The Uzbek businesswoman at the heart of an impending Swiss money-laundering trial involving Lombard Odier & Cie was unfairly detained by her government for years, a United Nations panel concluded.
title: Uzbek in Swiss Money-Laundering Case Was Unfairly Detained, Says UN Panel

author: Patrick Van Oosterom, Sarah Jacob, Alice Atkins
description: Nearly 11 million people in the Netherlands will switch to a new retirement plan from January 2026, as the country embarks on a pension overhaul that’s widely expected to spur volatility across European bond markets.
title: Dutch Pensions Overhaul to Move 11 Million to New System in Just Six Months

author: Francesca Stevens, Nguyen Dieu Tu Uyen, Jennifer A Dlouhy
description: President Donald Trump said he had reached a trade deal with Vietnam following weeks of intense diplomacy between the nations and ahead of a deadline next week that would have seen higher tariffs imposed on the country’s imports.
title: Trump Announces Vietnam Trade Deal With 20% Import Tariff

author: Andrea Palasciano, Andra Timu, Samy Adghirni
description: Some of Ukraine’s allies are shifting their focus elsewhere just as the war-battered nation struggles with a fresh volley of missile and drone attacks in its fourth summer of Russia’s full-scale invasion.
title: Key Ukrainian Allies Are Shifting Focus to Other Priorities

author: Daniel Basteiro, Matthew Hill
description: Mozambican President Daniel Chapo said his government and private companies will have to collectively ensure the necessary security is in place to enable TotalEnergies SE to restart construction of a $20 billion gas project that has stalled due to a militant insurgency — and even then risks will remain.
title: Mozambique President Urges Total LNG Restart Despite Risks

author: Greg Ritchie
description: UK bonds and the pound sold off on concern around the nation’s fiscal policies.
title: UK Bonds and Pound Fall as Doubts Surround Chancellor’s Position

author: Emily Birnbaum
description: The leader of a hardline conservative caucus in the House on Wednesday cast doubt on the prospect President Donald Trump’s sprawling tax and spending legislation will be completed by July 4.
title: House Republican Hardliners Warn of a Delay to Tax Vote

author: Alex Wickham, Joe Mayes, Ailbhe Rea
description: Prime Minister Keir Starmer failed to fully back Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves after a U-turn on the government’s flagship welfare reforms derailed her fiscal plans.
title: Starmer Declines to Confirm Reeves Will Stay as UK Chancellor

author: Patpicha Tanakasempipat
description: The billionaire dynasty that has dominated Thailand’s politics for more than two decades is on the cusp of being ousted from high office yet again. Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra was suspended by the Constitutional Court pending a ruling on allegations of ethical misconduct.
title: Why Thailand’s Shinawatra Dynasty Is on the Brink of Losing Power Once Again

author: James Mayger
description: The trade truce between Washington and Beijing may be holding for now, but China is increasingly wary about what’s happening elsewhere: US efforts to forge deals that could isolate Chinese firms from global supply chains.
title: Beijing Braces for US Trade Deals That Seek to Shut Out China

author: Andra Timu
description: Romania is set to present a fiscal package of tax hikes and wage freezes in the public sector to scale back the budget deficit to below 6% of economic output next year, people familiar with the matter said.
title: Romania Seeks Austerity Plan to Slash the EU’s Widest Budget Gap

author: Paul Vecchiatto
description: Changing the ownership structure of the South African Reserve Bank could generate fears among investors about expropriation and create more uncertainty about property rights, according to the National Treasury.
title: South African Treasury Warns Against Changing SARB Ownership

author: Yian Lee
description: Lai is touring the island urging residents to unite against growing pressure from Beijing
title: Taiwanese President Lai Chooses to Confront China

author: Joao Lima, Francine Lacqua
description: Bank of Portugal Governor Mario Centeno said that he wants to continue serving as head of the country’s central bank, days before his first term is set to end.
title: Bank of Portugal’s Centeno Says He’d Like to Serve a New Term

author: Arun Devnath
description: A tribunal in Bangladesh has sentenced former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina to six months in prison for contempt of court, the first verdict in any case against her since her government collapsed in August last year.
title: Bangladesh Court Sentences Ex-PM Hasina to Prison for Contempt

author: Andrea Navarro, Maya Averbuch
description: A surge in cargo theft has companies and truck drivers on edge, compounding President Claudia Sheinbaum’s security woes
title: Highway Robberies Are Now Just Part of Doing Business in Mexico

author: Andrea Navarro, Maya Averbuch
description: Un aumento en el robo de carga tiene en alerta a empresas y transportistas, y complica el panorama de seguridad de Claudia Sheinbaum
title: Asaltos en carretera: ya son parte del costo de hacer negocios en México

author: Raeedah Wahid, Jennah Haque, Elena Mejia, Marie Patino
description: He’s now betting his mosaic of supporters will help him defeat a competitive field in November
title: Mamdani’s Unprecedented Coalition May Decide New York City's Future

author: Brendan Murray
description: The US is arguably never more dependent on China than on July 4, when the nation celebrates its rebellion against British rule with fireworks that are inevitably imported from China.
title: Why Your Fourth of July Fireworks May Be Disrupted — Next Year

author: Erica Yokoyama
description: Japan’s tax revenues hit a record of around ¥75.2 trillion ($524 billion) in the fiscal year ended March, surpassing government forecasts by ¥1.8 trillion. But the windfall still left questions over how Prime Minister Shigeru Ishiba will fund his cash handouts, a key election pledge.
title: Japan’s Record Tax Haul Leaves Questions Over Ishiba’s Pledge

author: Hatem Mohareb, Salma El Wardany
description: Chevron Corp. and TotalEnergies SE are competing in Libya’s first energy exploration tender since the 2011 conflict, the country’s state-run oil firm said, as the OPEC member looks to oil majors to help ramp up production to a record.
title: Chevron, Total Vying in Libya’s First Oil Tender Since 2011 War

author: Cliff Harvey Venzon
description: Lithuania will consider a visiting forces agreement with the Philippines, as it builds security ties with the Southeast Asian nation while criticizing Beijing’s actions in the South China Sea.
title: Lithuania Eyes Troops Visit Pact With Philippines, Slams China

author: David Herbling
description: Kenya needs to tackle graft that’s draining the nation’s finances and undermining economic growth, according to the African Development Bank.
title: State Capture, Graft Holding Back Kenya’s Economy, AfDB Says

author: Sudhi Ranjan Sen
description: The 14th Dalai Lama, spiritual leader of the Tibetans, has confirmed that the institution of the Dalai Lama will continue and that a successor will be named.
title: Dalai Lama Confirms Institution Will Continue With Successor

author: Hannah Miller, Zoe Tillman
description: Paramount Global reached a settlement with President Donald Trump over a lawsuit that alleged election interference by the company’s CBS news network when it showed two different versions of a 60 Minutes interview with then-Vice President Kamala Harris in October.
title: Paramount Settles Trump’s ‘60 Minutes’ Suit for $16 Million

author: Alex Vasquez
description: Mexico’s Senate approved several government-backed security bills that aim to bolster crime fighting by improving investigation and intelligence capacities, an approach the opposition says risks allowing invasive surveillance.
title: Mexico Senate OKs Security Bills Modeled on Sheinbaum’s Approach

author: Rosa Prince
description: The cost of funding for King Charles and his family announced as Labour rebels reject benefit cuts.
title: UK Royals Can Sacrifice More Than Queen Victoria’s Train

author: Robert Burnson
description: The Trump administration told a federal appeals court it has been unable to locate a man wrongly deported to El Salvador a week after a three-judge panel ordered that he be returned to the US.
title: US Tells Court It Can’t Locate Man Wrongly Sent to El Salvador

author: Philip Heijmans, Patpicha Tanakasempipat, Suttinee Yuvejwattana
description: Thailand’s ruling coalition was already fraying when a court suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra on Tuesday, raising fresh doubts about her survival, the country’s economy and the future of a dynasty that has loomed over the Southeast Asian nation for decades.
title: Thai Leader’s Suspension Deals New Blow to Battered Economy

author: Allen K Wan
description: Israel urged China to use its economic and political sway to rein in Iran’s military and nuclear ambitions.
title: Israel Urges China to Pressure Iran to Rein in Nuclear Ambitions

author: John Liu, Yujing Liu, Heng Xie
description: China faces growing calls from policy advisers and economists to explore using stablecoins for cross-border payments, as the US moves to entrench the dollar’s dominance through crypto technology.
title: China Urged to Embrace Stablecoins as US Moves to Cement Lead
